recommendations: HIV Risk HIGH: Recommend immediate HIV testing (HTS) and urgent clinical evaluation for PEP if a possible exposure occurred within 72 hours. Offer rapid HIV test now; if negative and exposure within 72 hours, evaluate for Post-Exposure Prophylaxis (PEP). Also initiate partner notification/index testing and discuss PrEP for ongoing risk. (NDOH HTS / PEP / PrEP guidance.)

Mental-health Risk HIGH (possible suicidality or severe distress): Immediate safety assessment is required. Follow emergency mental-health pathways: implement safety plan, do not leave the person alone, arrange urgent psychiatric/medical assessment or 72-hour involuntary assessment where indicated. (See NDoH emergency mental-health/72-hour assessment guidance.)
